1243891544580653057.text:
I’m live on @1039WDKX talking about the historic funding package we passed in the House of Representatives yesterday to provide relief for American families and small businesses who are struggling during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Tune in now!

1243602439502204928.text:

1226511192690188289.text: After his death at 77, Douglass was buried in Mt. Hope Cemetery here in #Roc. Two years later, a statue was erected in his honor — the first statue in US history to memorialize an African-American. The original stands at Highland Park and replicas can be seen all over the city.

1223659749939580928.text:
Connie passed away in 2018, but will always be remembered as a fierce leader and passionate activist whose advocacy helped open the door of opportunity for so many people of color in our community. 

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we come together to say: #ThankYouConnie.

1223659748895207424.text:
Her pursuit of equality expanded beyond the Rochester community, too. She regularly hosted nationally-known civil rights activists like Malcom X, Dick Gregory, and Robert Kennedy into her home in the city.

She even marched in Selma, AL with Dr. King.

1223659747959812102.text:
Connie was the first African-American woman elected in Monroe County and served two terms on the Board of Supervisors – and that's just the beginning of her historic legacy. 
 
Fiercely dedicated to fighting injustice, Connie advocated locally against worker discrimination.

1223659744973524992.text:
This #BlackHistoryMonth, I want to highlight some of the incredible and iconic African-American leaders from our community, starting with someone who was a true force in the fight for civil rights: Connie Mitchell.

#BHM https://t.co/GuUBFFMER1

1140724510628466688.text: Over the past two decades, the cost of prescription diabetes drugs like Insulin have skyrocketed. Studies show that manufacturers could charge $7-$11 per month for insulin and still make a profit – yet prices for these drugs continue to rise to over $450 per month.
